intro.p: In Summer 2025, a medical research nonprofit randomly surveyed 1,100 registered voters in {{state_1}} and {{state_2}} about proposed restrictions on access to medication abortion (like mifepristone). The survey was conducted in English and {{language}}.
Survey respondents were asked to what degree they agreed with the following statements, using a 5-point scale: “Strongly Agree,” “Agree,” “Neutral,” “Disagree,” or “Strongly Disagree.”

item.p: The unaccountable FDA should not be allowed to recklessly and irresponsibly expand access to abortion pills through unregulated telehealth schemes without meaningful oversight.
Overreaching states should not have the unchecked authority to impose extreme bans on widely used and medically approved abortion drugs under the guise of protecting life.
